intro: Schnella microstachya var. massambabensis, commonly known as the Massambaba snakeweed, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
